content: Write a sonnet about stars with exactly 70 words.

Twinkling diamonds in the velvet night,
Stars whisper secrets to the moon's soft glow.
Each a world of mysteries, far and bright,
Guiding dreams where mortals dare to go.

In their silent dance, eternity's revealed,
Through eons, they've watched Earth spin and play.
Their light, a testament, ancient and healed,
Connecting time, in endless cosmic way.

So I gaze up, heart ablaze with wonder,
Under the stars, my soul takes flight.
In their embrace, I find my ponder,
A fleeting moment, bathed in pure light.

Oh, stars above, your beauty never fades,
In your constancy, my spirit is swayed.
